metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1064 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
libvirt version before 4.2.0-rc1 is vulnerable to a resource exhaustion as a result of an incomplete fix for CVE-2018-5748 that affects QEMU monitor but now also triggered via QEMU guest agent.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-clients - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-system - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-sanlock - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-wireshark - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt0 - 5.0.0-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1ubuntu2').
